Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEDIAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Channel 2/Channel 1 ratio normalized, RAT2_MEDIAN/Normalization factor or Red/Green median ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LOG_RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the median of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEDIAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB1254 WT vs Rv3662c-3665c KO in 7H9OADC, OD 1.5-2

Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: not provided

Channel.Growth-Protocol: GROWTH CONDITIONS OPP STUDY; Culture were made using Middlebrook 7H9 media (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), containing 10% Middlebrook oleic-acid-dextrose-catalase (OADC) enrichment (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), 0.5% glycerol (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA, USA) and 0.05% Tween 80 (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), or 7H10 agar (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) containing 10% OADC and 0.5% glycerol.Mtb strain 1254 wild type (WT) and its isogenic ??opp KO and complemented strains were cultured in liquid media, in a 150 mL volume, contained in roller bottles, and incubated at 37??C. When cells reached OD600 nm of 0.3, 1.0, and 2.0, an aliquot of 30, 10, and 10 mL, respectively, was taken, centrifuged 3 min at 3000 g, at room temperature, and the supernatant was discarded, with cell pellets being immediately frozen by inclusion into dry ice. Frozen cell pellets were stored at -80??C for later RNA isolation.; Protocol Type = Growth Conditions; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Extract-Protocol: EXTRACT PREPARATION OPP STUDY; M. tb. RNA isolation. 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.15-0.2) 5m at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ???80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Invitrogen) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing, while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.5 mL glass beads in a 2 mL screw cap tube. If cells are either from OD 0.8 or above, or from experiments for ST-CF, use 2 mL of Trizol. Dispense only1 mL of the suspension into the 2 mL tubes with glass beads. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample. Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 1 min at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 mL Phase Lock Gel Heavy tube (Eppendorf). Make sure that the volume is 1 mL; if not, complete the volume using fresh Trizol, up to 1mL. Add 300??l Chloroform, and invert rapidly for 15s. Continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10 min, remove aqueous layer (540??l) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270??l isopropanol. Then add 265??l high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically precipitated at 4??C overnight (or can be precipitated in -20c for 2-3 hrs). Note: Using 270 ??L of ammonium acetate 5 M pH 5.2, and 270 ??L of isopropanol, with incubation overnight at 4??C, as well as making sure the Trizol volume combined with chloroform was 1 mL, RNA practically genomic DNA-free was obtained. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4??C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5min. 7. Remove ethanol by drying under vacuum 2m [Do not over dry] (this take around 20 min or so). 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Column.Description: Median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature background intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature background intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH1D_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 532 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2D_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1_PER_SAT
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels at wavelength 532 nm that are saturated.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2_PER_SAT
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels at wavelength 635 nm that are saturated.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1I_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature background intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature background intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEAN
Column.Description: The sum of the arithmetic mean intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The sum of the median intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each spot for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted. Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio, (CH1I_MEAN - CH1B_MEDIAN)/(CH2I_MEAN - CH2B_MEDIAN) or Green/Red ratio.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the median intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The geometric mean of the pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median of pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_SD
Column.Description: The geometric standard deviation of the pixel intensity ratios.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: The total number of feature pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: The total number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: DIAMETER
Column.Description: The diameter in um of the feature-indicator.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: X_COORD
Column.Description: X-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN

Column.Name: LOG_RAT2N_MEAN

Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the median of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEDIAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEAN
Column.Description: The sum of the arithmetic mean intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The sum of the median intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each spot for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted. Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio, (CH1I_MEAN - CH1B_MEDIAN)/(CH2I_MEAN - CH2B_MEDIAN) or Green/Red ratio.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the median intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The geometric mean of the pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median of pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_SD
Column.Description: The geometric standard deviation of the pixel intensity ratios.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: The total number of feature pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: The total number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: DIAMETER
Column.Description: The diameter in um of the feature-indicator.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: X_COORD
Column.Description: X-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEDIAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Channel 2/Channel 1 ratio normalized, RAT2_MEDIAN/Normalization factor or Red/Green median ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LOG_RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the median of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEDIAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB1254 WT vs Rv3662c-3665c KO in 7H9OADC, OD 1.5-4

Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: not provided

Channel.Growth-Protocol: GROWTH CONDITIONS OPP STUDY; Culture were made using Middlebrook 7H9 media (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), containing 10% Middlebrook oleic-acid-dextrose-catalase (OADC) enrichment (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), 0.5% glycerol (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA, USA) and 0.05% Tween 80 (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), or 7H10 agar (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) containing 10% OADC and 0.5% glycerol.Mtb strain 1254 wild type (WT) and its isogenic ??opp KO and complemented strains were cultured in liquid media, in a 150 mL volume, contained in roller bottles, and incubated at 37??C. When cells reached OD600 nm of 0.3, 1.0, and 2.0, an aliquot of 30, 10, and 10 mL, respectively, was taken, centrifuged 3 min at 3000 g, at room temperature, and the supernatant was discarded, with cell pellets being immediately frozen by inclusion into dry ice. Frozen cell pellets were stored at -80??C for later RNA isolation.; Protocol Type = Growth Conditions; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Extract-Protocol: EXTRACT PREPARATION OPP STUDY; M. tb. RNA isolation. 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.15-0.2) 5m at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ???80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Invitrogen) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing, while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.5 mL glass beads in a 2 mL screw cap tube. If cells are either from OD 0.8 or above, or from experiments for ST-CF, use 2 mL of Trizol. Dispense only1 mL of the suspension into the 2 mL tubes with glass beads. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample. Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 1 min at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 mL Phase Lock Gel Heavy tube (Eppendorf). Make sure that the volume is 1 mL; if not, complete the volume using fresh Trizol, up to 1mL. Add 300??l Chloroform, and invert rapidly for 15s. Continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10 min, remove aqueous layer (540??l) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270??l isopropanol. Then add 265??l high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically precipitated at 4??C overnight (or can be precipitated in -20c for 2-3 hrs). Note: Using 270 ??L of ammonium acetate 5 M pH 5.2, and 270 ??L of isopropanol, with incubation overnight at 4??C, as well as making sure the Trizol volume combined with chloroform was 1 mL, RNA practically genomic DNA-free was obtained. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4??C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5min. 7. Remove ethanol by drying under vacuum 2m [Do not over dry] (this take around 20 min or so). 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Sample.Description: biological sample opp study; the clinical mtb isolate 1254 was used as the parental, wild type (wt) for construction of the permease knock-out and complemented strains.; protocol type = biological sample; performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2006-04/68093.gif

Sample.Title: MTB1254 WT vs Rv3662c-3665c KO in 7H9OADC-Exp2, OD1-2

Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: not provided

Channel.Growth-Protocol: GROWTH CONDITIONS OPP STUDY; Culture were made using Middlebrook 7H9 media (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), containing 10% Middlebrook oleic-acid-dextrose-catalase (OADC) enrichment (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), 0.5% glycerol (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA, USA) and 0.05% Tween 80 (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), or 7H10 agar (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) containing 10% OADC and 0.5% glycerol.Mtb strain 1254 wild type (WT) and its isogenic ??opp KO and complemented strains were cultured in liquid media, in a 150 mL volume, contained in roller bottles, and incubated at 37??C. When cells reached OD600 nm of 0.3, 1.0, and 2.0, an aliquot of 30, 10, and 10 mL, respectively, was taken, centrifuged 3 min at 3000 g, at room temperature, and the supernatant was discarded, with cell pellets being immediately frozen by inclusion into dry ice. Frozen cell pellets were stored at -80??C for later RNA isolation.; Protocol Type = Growth Conditions; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Extract-Protocol: EXTRACT PREPARATION OPP STUDY; M. tb. RNA isolation. 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.15-0.2) 5m at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ???80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Invitrogen) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing, while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.5 mL glass beads in a 2 mL screw cap tube. If cells are either from OD 0.8 or above, or from experiments for ST-CF, use 2 mL of Trizol. Dispense only1 mL of the suspension into the 2 mL tubes with glass beads. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample. Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 1 min at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 mL Phase Lock Gel Heavy tube (Eppendorf). Make sure that the volume is 1 mL; if not, complete the volume using fresh Trizol, up to 1mL. Add 300??l Chloroform, and invert rapidly for 15s. Continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10 min, remove aqueous layer (540??l) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270??l isopropanol. Then add 265??l high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically precipitated at 4??C overnight (or can be precipitated in -20c for 2-3 hrs). Note: Using 270 ??L of ammonium acetate 5 M pH 5.2, and 270 ??L of isopropanol, with incubation overnight at 4??C, as well as making sure the Trizol volume combined with chloroform was 1 mL, RNA practically genomic DNA-free was obtained. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4??C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5min. 7. Remove ethanol by drying under vacuum 2m [Do not over dry] (this take around 20 min or so). 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: The total number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: DIAMETER
Column.Description: The diameter in um of the feature-indicator.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: X_COORD
Column.Description: X-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEDIAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Channel 2/Channel 1 ratio normalized, RAT2_MEDIAN/Normalization factor or Red/Green median ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LOG_RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the median of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEDIAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB1254 WT vs Rv3662c-3665c KO in 7H9OADC-Exp2, OD 0.3-4

Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: not provided

Channel.Growth-Protocol: GROWTH CONDITIONS OPP STUDY; Culture were made using Middlebrook 7H9 media (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), containing 10% Middlebrook oleic-acid-dextrose-catalase (OADC) enrichment (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), 0.5% glycerol (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA, USA) and 0.05% Tween 80 (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), or 7H10 agar (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) containing 10% OADC and 0.5% glycerol.Mtb strain 1254 wild type (WT) and its isogenic ??opp KO and complemented strains were cultured in liquid media, in a 150 mL volume, contained in roller bottles, and incubated at 37??C. When cells reached OD600 nm of 0.3, 1.0, and 2.0, an aliquot of 30, 10, and 10 mL, respectively, was taken, centrifuged 3 min at 3000 g, at room temperature, and the supernatant was discarded, with cell pellets being immediately frozen by inclusion into dry ice. Frozen cell pellets were stored at -80??C for later RNA isolation.; Protocol Type = Growth Conditions; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Extract-Protocol: EXTRACT PREPARATION OPP STUDY; M. tb. RNA isolation. 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.15-0.2) 5m at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ???80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Invitrogen) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing, while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.5 mL glass beads in a 2 mL screw cap tube. If cells are either from OD 0.8 or above, or from experiments for ST-CF, use 2 mL of Trizol. Dispense only1 mL of the suspension into the 2 mL tubes with glass beads. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample. Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 1 min at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 mL Phase Lock Gel Heavy tube (Eppendorf). Make sure that the volume is 1 mL; if not, complete the volume using fresh Trizol, up to 1mL. Add 300??l Chloroform, and invert rapidly for 15s. Continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10 min, remove aqueous layer (540??l) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270??l isopropanol. Then add 265??l high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically precipitated at 4??C overnight (or can be precipitated in -20c for 2-3 hrs). Note: Using 270 ??L of ammonium acetate 5 M pH 5.2, and 270 ??L of isopropanol, with incubation overnight at 4??C, as well as making sure the Trizol volume combined with chloroform was 1 mL, RNA practically genomic DNA-free was obtained. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4??C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5min. 7. Remove ethanol by drying under vacuum 2m [Do not over dry] (this take around 20 min or so). 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Sample.Title: MTB1254 WT vs Rv3662c-3665c KO in 7H9OADC-Exp2, OD1.5-4

Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: not provided

Channel.Growth-Protocol: GROWTH CONDITIONS OPP STUDY; Culture were made using Middlebrook 7H9 media (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), containing 10% Middlebrook oleic-acid-dextrose-catalase (OADC) enrichment (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), 0.5% glycerol (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA, USA) and 0.05% Tween 80 (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), or 7H10 agar (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) containing 10% OADC and 0.5% glycerol.Mtb strain 1254 wild type (WT) and its isogenic ??opp KO and complemented strains were cultured in liquid media, in a 150 mL volume, contained in roller bottles, and incubated at 37??C. When cells reached OD600 nm of 0.3, 1.0, and 2.0, an aliquot of 30, 10, and 10 mL, respectively, was taken, centrifuged 3 min at 3000 g, at room temperature, and the supernatant was discarded, with cell pellets being immediately frozen by inclusion into dry ice. Frozen cell pellets were stored at -80??C for later RNA isolation.; Protocol Type = Growth Conditions; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Extract-Protocol: EXTRACT PREPARATION OPP STUDY; M. tb. RNA isolation. 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.15-0.2) 5m at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ???80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Invitrogen) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing, while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.5 mL glass beads in a 2 mL screw cap tube. If cells are either from OD 0.8 or above, or from experiments for ST-CF, use 2 mL of Trizol. Dispense only1 mL of the suspension into the 2 mL tubes with glass beads. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample. Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 1 min at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 mL Phase Lock Gel Heavy tube (Eppendorf). Make sure that the volume is 1 mL; if not, complete the volume using fresh Trizol, up to 1mL. Add 300??l Chloroform, and invert rapidly for 15s. Continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10 min, remove aqueous layer (540??l) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270??l isopropanol. Then add 265??l high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically precipitated at 4??C overnight (or can be precipitated in -20c for 2-3 hrs). Note: Using 270 ??L of ammonium acetate 5 M pH 5.2, and 270 ??L of isopropanol, with incubation overnight at 4??C, as well as making sure the Trizol volume combined with chloroform was 1 mL, RNA practically genomic DNA-free was obtained. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4??C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5min. 7. Remove ethanol by drying under vacuum 2m [Do not over dry] (this take around 20 min or so). 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Sample.Description: biological sample opp study; the clinical mtb isolate 1254 was used as the parental, wild type (wt) for construction of the permease knock-out and complemented strains.; protocol type = biological sample; performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2006-05/68499.gif

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean feature pixel intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature background intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature background intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity at wavelength 532 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: .The mean feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1I_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2I_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature background intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature background intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH1D_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 532 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2D_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1_PER_SAT
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels at wavelength 532 nm that are saturated.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2_PER_SAT
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels at wavelength 635 nm that are saturated.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1I_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature background intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature background intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEAN
Column.Description: The sum of the arithmetic mean intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The sum of the median intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each spot for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted. Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio, (CH1I_MEAN - CH1B_MEDIAN)/(CH2I_MEAN - CH2B_MEDIAN) or Green/Red ratio.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the median intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The geometric mean of the pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median of pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_SD
Column.Description: The geometric standard deviation of the pixel intensity ratios.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: The total number of feature pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: The total number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: DIAMETER
Column.Description: The diameter in um of the feature-indicator.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: X_COORD
Column.Description: X-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEDIAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Channel 2/Channel 1 ratio normalized, RAT2_MEDIAN/Normalization factor or Red/Green median ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LOG_RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the median of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEDIAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Description: X-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEDIAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Channel 2/Channel 1 ratio normalized, RAT2_MEDIAN/Normalization factor or Red/Green median ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LOG_RAT2N_MEAN

Sample.Title: MTB1254 WT vs Rv3662c-3665c KO in 7H9OADC, OD 1.0-3

Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: not provided

Channel.Growth-Protocol: GROWTH CONDITIONS OPP STUDY; Culture were made using Middlebrook 7H9 media (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), containing 10% Middlebrook oleic-acid-dextrose-catalase (OADC) enrichment (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA), 0.5% glycerol (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA, USA) and 0.05% Tween 80 (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA), or 7H10 agar (BD, Franklin Lakes, NJ, USA) containing 10% OADC and 0.5% glycerol.Mtb strain 1254 wild type (WT) and its isogenic ??opp KO and complemented strains were cultured in liquid media, in a 150 mL volume, contained in roller bottles, and incubated at 37??C. When cells reached OD600 nm of 0.3, 1.0, and 2.0, an aliquot of 30, 10, and 10 mL, respectively, was taken, centrifuged 3 min at 3000 g, at room temperature, and the supernatant was discarded, with cell pellets being immediately frozen by inclusion into dry ice. Frozen cell pellets were stored at -80??C for later RNA isolation.; Protocol Type = Growth Conditions; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Extract-Protocol: EXTRACT PREPARATION OPP STUDY; M. tb. RNA isolation. 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.15-0.2) 5m at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ???80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Invitrogen) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing, while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.5 mL glass beads in a 2 mL screw cap tube. If cells are either from OD 0.8 or above, or from experiments for ST-CF, use 2 mL of Trizol. Dispense only1 mL of the suspension into the 2 mL tubes with glass beads. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample. Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 1 min at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 mL Phase Lock Gel Heavy tube (Eppendorf). Make sure that the volume is 1 mL; if not, complete the volume using fresh Trizol, up to 1mL. Add 300??l Chloroform, and invert rapidly for 15s. Continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10 min, remove aqueous layer (540??l) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270??l isopropanol. Then add 265??l high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically precipitated at 4??C overnight (or can be precipitated in -20c for 2-3 hrs). Note: Using 270 ??L of ammonium acetate 5 M pH 5.2, and 270 ??L of isopropanol, with incubation overnight at 4??C, as well as making sure the Trizol volume combined with chloroform was 1 mL, RNA practically genomic DNA-free was obtained. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4??C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5min. 7. Remove ethanol by drying under vacuum 2m [Do not over dry] (this take around 20 min or so). 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ul RNase free water (don???t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration). 9. Add 10??l 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ??g RNA) and add 2??l DNaseI. Incubate 30min at 37??C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350??l RLT buffer (add 10??l ??-mercaptoethanol to 1 ml RLT before using), vortex, and add 265??l 95% EtOH to each sample, vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500??l RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500??l additional RPE and centrifuge 2 min. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1min to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40??l RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1??l in 199??l TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 x A260 = ng/??l]. 5. Run 1??l RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200??l. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: AMPLIFICATION AND LABELING OPP STUDY; 1. Bring 0.5-5??g RNA (Typically 2-3 ??g) to 11??l and add 2.0 ??l (2 mg/ml) N6 primers. 2. Heat 2min at 98??C, Snap cool on ice in PCR rack kept in ice. 3. Add 12 ??l (keep on ice) of the next mixture: 2.5??l 10X Stratascript Buffer 3.5??l RNase free H20 2.5??l dNTP (5mM A,G,C and 0.2mM T) 1.5??l Cy3 or Cy5 (Cy5 for experimental sample) 2.0??l Stratascript Reverse Transcriptase. 4. Incubate 10 min at 25??C (room temperature) followed by 90 min at 42??C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4??C o/n. 5. Add both reactions to a microcon10 (Amicon) with 400??l TE. Centrifuge at 13000 rpm until ~25??l remaining (~20min). Add 200??l more TE and spin until almost dry (~12min) (< 5??l). (make sure that the cup is really dry and the color should be purple) (START THE PRE HYB OF SLIDES FOR 1 HR). 7. Recover cDNA by inverting microcon into new collection 1.5 ml tube and centrifuge at half max speed 1min (8000 rpm/1 min). 8. Bring sample to 5??l with TE and transfer to a 0.5 ml PCR tube.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Mario Alberto,,Flores-Valdez

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN

Column.Name: CH1D_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 532 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2D_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1_PER_SAT
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels at wavelength 532 nm that are saturated.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2_PER_SAT
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels at wavelength 635 nm that are saturated.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH1I_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature pixel intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature background intensity at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_SD
Column.Description: The standard deviation of the feature background intensity at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_2SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than two standard deviations above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEAN
Column.Description: The sum of the arithmetic mean intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: SUM_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The sum of the median intensities for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each spot for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted. Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio, (CH1I_MEAN - CH1B_MEDIAN)/(CH2I_MEAN - CH2B_MEDIAN) or Green/Red ratio.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the arithmetic mean intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The ratio of the median intensities of each feature for each wavelength, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEAN
Column.Description: The geometric mean of the pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: The median of pixel-by-pixel ratios of pixel intensities, with the median background subtracted.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT2_SD
Column.Description: The geometric standard deviation of the pixel intensity ratios.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: The total number of feature pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: The total number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: DIAMETER
Column.Description: The diameter in um of the feature-indicator.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: X_COORD
Column.Description: X-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: Y_COORD
Column.Description: Y-coordinate of the center of the spot-indicator associated with the spot, where (0,0) is the top left of the image.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: The type of flag associated with a feature: -100 = user-flagged null spot; -50 = software-flagged null spot; 0 = spot valid.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel
